Posts.Content: Hello Everyone  ,  Hope your all ok ?  I’m due to start my Filgrastim injections on Saturday and wonder if anyone has any tips for these ? Do I need any painkillers etc ?  Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hey Collies ,  How are you feeling and how did it go ?  Everything is good this end got number two next Tuesday and felt good again since Friday thank god !!  Hair seems to be ok at the minute so it’s erm interesting to say the least waiting to see what happens !
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone :-)  So far after the third injection and day 7 today I’m feeling ok - feel like I’m waiting for the worst tho lol xxx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hello Collies ,  Honestly I’m amazed at how well this is all going it’s actually starting to worry me that somethings gonna appear any day or later on lol  Chemo was a week ago tomorrow now I’ve been tired but I have a 2 year old who wakes at 5 daily so I’m always tired ha ha .  Injections are going well I have done them myself and I only have one more day to go tomorrow . I don’t feel any different since being on them !!  I did do the cold cap but I don’t know if I will do it again think I’m going to just wait and see what falls out in the next two weeks then decide . As much as I done it I didn’t like it if anything it was the chin strap that drove me mental for theee hours but the worry I have is if hair does fall out will it be even more uncomfy with less hair so I’m kind of waiting now to see what happens lol xxx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone ❤️ So finally today I have my chemo chat then first Infusion is on Tuesday of Fec-t .  I’m 32 with triple negative breast cancer husband and a little boy who turns 2 next month !!  Is it wrong that i have leaped out of bed today and I’m full of excitement that it’s so close to all starting now !!!???  I found my lump 15/9 was then diagnosed 18/10 two days before my 32nd birthday so it’s been a long nearly 4 months and I just want to get going !!!  Any tips for the chemo chat ? Anything I should ask ? X
Posts.Title: Chemo chat today

Posts.Content: Hello Shimmering Unicorn ,  Hope your well ?   I’m part time in a restaurant that I only started at in June too and as much as they have been so supportive and keeping my job open for me I’m hitting a brick wall with everything else :-(  I had to do the bank over the phone with the Macmillan support team as that’s how Lloyds do it now - not that it got me anywhere lol xx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello beautiful unicorn   My god yes a huge relief I get to have Christmas with the boys . First chemo is the 9th jan so getting close now but everything seems to be falling in to place thank god !!  How are you ? Xxx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Ha ha totally agree with the pre baby that’s exactly what I have been saying too lol !!!  Everyone has said this is the worst part the waiting game and I totally agree it so is everything changes daily and it’s just doing my actual head in .  So I requested from day one that nothing starts till Boxing Day onwards due to work and having a nearly 2 year old which they agreed with but now they have rung today to say that oncology want me to have my first round of chemo before xmas which means financially we will be screwed as I was working up till xmas day . I’ve booked family days out of the back of this and made all our December plans around this . To many it may be silly but Christmas is my favourite time of year . It took us 5 years to have our baby and our first xmas last year myself and the baby had nurovirus from xmas eve for 5 days so it was a complete write of I just wanted this year to be perfect for us all let alone George !!  Because I have lost so much money since finding the lump on 15th September due to appointments being only on my working days and 3 trips to London for tests I was working a huge amount of extra shifts December including xmas day for a couple of hours to make up what I have lost and basically have a little bit of money in the bank to fall back on as we won’t get no financial help il be lucky if I get pro rata ssp So now they have said all these plans are basically being pushed aside I feel literally anxious as anything and stressed to the actual max !!!!  I’ve got an appointment Thursday at 4 to discuss more then oncology was to see me on Monday with a veiw that chemo will be around the 18th of December week !!!  Tuesday count down for you I feel you :-(((
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello Kirsty ,  How is everything planning out for you now Hun ? Xxxx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hey Kirsty ,  God I can totally relate to how you feel !!! I found my lump right breast on 15th September then got diagnosed on 18th October . Two days before my 32nd birthday with Triple negative Breast cancer .  After weeks of tests and mris and biopsy’s I got my genetic results last Thursday to also be told I don’t have the gene . Again great news !!!  Like you I was told it would be a mastectomy on my right breast with reconstruction at the same time . I requested a double to be told highly unlikely as no cancer in the left breast but to keep pushing for it when results are in .  But when results did come in it quickly changed to a lumpectomy which for the first time since being diagnosed caused me to breakdown in the appointment because I had got my head round the mastectomy side .  Then the next day they called me again to say even though I had no genetic mutations Guys recommendation is that I’m to have a double mastectomy with reconstruction so now not only am I getting my one done that I wanted I’m actually getting both !!! ( so they say anyway ) so please check what they recommend for you too !!  My MDT are having the meeting today so I’m getting a phone call later this afternoon to be told exactly what’s being decided literally clock watching like anthing today badly - hate all the waiting xxxx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello Jo ,  Thanks for your message Yes we have applied for a grant so fingers crossed we will be approved we should know by the end of next week.  As for the mortgage there is nothing we can do as Lloyds charge so much interest to have the holiday plus it will go on our credit score as defaulted so when we go to renew December 2018 it could have implications for us and the new rate etc !!  Totally agree at the minute the financial worry is stressing me more and driving me insane as  Boxing Day onwards we will be ok but they now want to start earlier than agreed xx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello ladies Sorry for the delay in replying it’s been another crazy few weeks but thankfully now I can wind down and work for the xmas build up and actually enjoy it with my baby and husband due to oncology agreeing chemo can start after xmas   I’m having 6 rounds of Fec-t plus the Zoladex shots . Then il have a month off followed by double mastectomy with reconstruction at the start of summer .  All in all I’m so happy with the plan and now feeling like I just want to get going but I know the wait will be worth it seeing my boy on Christmas Day etc .  How is everyone ? Kirsty any update ? I can’t believe your appointment was cancelled
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello Jet ,  I have had two rounds of fec I have the third one on Tuesday and have used the cold cap .  I have only lost hair above my right ear and you can’t see it as I flip the rest over so my experience so far is good and I’m holding out hope the rest will keep it as much as possible .  I was so worried I wouldn’t be able to do the cap . Yes it adds time to your infusion but I think it’s worth it as keeping my hair is so important to me . I take pain killers a hour before and that made the second one so much better infact after the first 15 minutes which can be described as brain freeze i actually forgot I had it on for the rest .  The worst is always the first as it’s the unknown but I would say go for it and try !!! Xxx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and cold caps

Posts.Content: Hello Deb ,  Sorry for the late reply my little boy was two yesterday so it was a tad crazy lol !!   I’m the same I’ve shed lots but the only noticble bit seems to be above my right ear and hair line I can cover it at the minute but now it’s the wait to see how much more of it goes with number 3 due on Tuesday because I was the same it was just before number 2 it started to go  !!
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and cold caps

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying everyone :-)  Love how upbeat you all seem that’s definitely a bit of how I am anyway so I need to carry on with that mindset now .  So all I know at the minute is I’ve got to have a MRI , another ultrasound , microbubbles test then another results session . One lumps been diagnosed as breast cancer and they said it’s early stages . There is a lump in my other boob too which they are now going to recheck plus one in my neck which again I’ve been told not to worry about my the doctors but I can’t help but worry about it !!  I’ve got a 20 month old little boy and husband all close friends and family have been told but it all just seems so weird !! X
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today with Breast Cancer at 31

Posts.Content: Hello everyone ,  So today I was diagnosed with breast cancer after finding a lump 4 weeks ago .  Now wide awake , can’t sleep , minds on overload and don’t know what to do or say or think !!!  I’m still smiling though and haven’t cried is that even normal ??
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today with Breast Cancer at 31
